definition: Changjiang 長江|长江 or Yangtze River/old name for Changjiang, especially lower reaches around Yangzhou 揚州|扬州
abbr. for 揚州|扬州[Yang2 zhou1]/surname Yang
to raise/to hoist/the action of tossing or winnowing/scattering (in the wind)/to flutter/to propagate

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: Apart from being a departure point for Yangtze River cruises, Chongqing had little to see.
sentences.chinese: 除了它是扬子江游船的出发点外，重庆没什么可看的。

sentences.english: Yangzi River is one of the most beautiful rivers in the world.
sentences.chinese: 扬子江世纪世界上最美的河流之一。

definition: Three Gorges on the Chang Jiang or Yangtze, namely: Qutang Gorge 瞿塘峽|瞿塘峡[Qu2 tang2 Xia2], Wuxia Gorge 巫峽|巫峡[Wu1 Xia2] and Xiling Gorge 西陵峽|西陵峡[Xi1 ling2 Xia2]/Sanxia or Sanhsia town in New Taipei City 新北市[Xin1 bei3 shi4], Taiwan
Jiang'an district of Wuhan city 武漢市|武汉市[Wu3 han4 shi4], Hubei
Nananqu district of central Chongqing municipality, formerly in Sichuan
Jialing river in Sichuan (a tributary of the Yangtze)
Huai River, main river of east China, between the Yellow River 黃河|黄河[Huang2 He2] and the Changjiang 長江|长江[Chang2 Jiang1]
Gan River in Jiangxi Province 江西省[Jiang1 xi1 Sheng3]
Qiantang River that loops around Hangzhou 杭州[Hang2 zhou1] in Zhejiang Province 浙江省[Zhe4 jiang1 Sheng3]
